duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform general orthopedic surgery and provide a full complement of orthopedic services.
Collaborate with the multidisciplinary team to provide acute musculoskeletal injury care, total joint replacements, and other orthopedic procedures.
Possibility of leadership role in healthcare and academic appointment.
Participate in trauma call with other orthopedic partners for shared trauma care.
Provide orthopedic care, including surgical procedures, in multiple clinic locations.
Collaborate with primary care group and other healthcare professionals to support the orthopedic program.
Utilize top-notch equipment, including robot access, for orthopedic surgical cases.
Contribute to exceptional quality outcomes in orthopedic care and surgical procedures.

education_certification.credential: Doctor of Medicine (MD) or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO) degree
Board Certification in Orthopedic Surgery or eligibility for certification
